page.title: 17R.A.F.Finningley Air Show
page.content: An annual occasion when R.A.F. Finningley is{at home to the public,} it commemorates September 15th.1940 Battle of Britain Day,the turning point in the second World War. This event usually attracts crowds of over 100,000.The flying display lasts 4 hours, & includes a Battle of Britain Memorial Flight with Spitfires Lancasters,& Hurricanes.Jet planes are well represented & helicopters demonstrate rescues. The Air Race for the King's Cup,first awarded by George V in 1922 also takes place.The Red Arrows,a team of aerobatic aircraft, figure hugely. Other attractions include parachute displays,hot air balloons,hang_gliding & parascending.There are static displays of aircraft,& other R.A.F. activities.Also bands play,a funfair operates,& refreshments abound.
